solution_line_template: They sold {num_regular_ducks} regular size rubber ducks at ${price_regular_duck} each so they made {num_regular_ducks}*{price_regular_duck} = $<<{num_regular_ducks}*{price_regular_duck}={revenue_regular_ducks}>>{revenue_regular_ducks}

They sold {num_large_ducks} large rubber ducks at ${price_large_duck} each so they made {num_large_ducks}*{price_large_duck} = $<<{num_large_ducks}*{price_large_duck}={revenue_large_ducks}>>{revenue_large_ducks}

The regular size ducks brought in ${revenue_regular_ducks} and the large brought in ${revenue_large_ducks} for a total of {revenue_regular_ducks}+{revenue_large_ducks} = $<<{revenue_regular_ducks}+{revenue_large_ducks}={total_revenue}>>{total_revenue} for charity
